The closure of New Jersey PBS is a loss for all of us who live here. Their programming benefits all New Jerseyans young and old.

I’ll continue to stand up to the attacks on public broadcasting and support local networks in Jersey and across the country.

L’Shanah Tovah to all those celebrating Rosh Hashanah and warm wishes for a peaceful, prosperous, and sweet year ahead. May this period of deep introspection and renewal remind us of our moral responsibility to one another and the greater good of humanity.
Trump and Republicans control the White House and both houses of Congress, any shut down will be due to their failure of leadership. https://t.co/gNv0Ln4cJz

The Supreme Court has once again declined to stop Trump from bending the rule of law to its breaking point. Congress created independent agencies like the FTC to insulate them from political influence— including the firing of commissioners who don’t do as the president demands.
https://t.co/TwnEUIfi19

We are seeing a roll back of the freedom of speech, freedom of expression, and freedom of the press not just on late-night, but at all levels of society, we must stand united for our freedoms.

That’s why I’m proud to announce the NOPE Act to prevent presidents from weaponizing government to punish critics.

It was an honor to accept the John Lewis Good Trouble award. May we all take inspiration from the towering legacy of John Lewis, and work together to make the promise of freedom and justice real for all. https://t.co/u4AVU3MDvK
This Constitution Day I reaffirm my commitment to standing for “We the People” against Donald Trump and JD Vance’s continued attempts to trample on our founding principles.
We must stand up for working Americans who are hurting in Trump’s failed economy. https://t.co/gjzvaLAKaw

As I have said, I will not give away my vote to Trump to fund the government for nothing. 

A funding bill that continues to raise our costs, jeopardizes our health care, and hurts the people of my state does not have my support.
Kash Patel has made our country less safe. He has put fealty to Trump over his sworn oath to the constitution. https://t.co/orO0lxqG8L
Hispanic Heritage Month is a time to recognize the remarkable history and indelible voice that the hispanic community has in New Jersey and across our nation. #HispanicHeritageMonth

September 11th will forever be a day of sorrow and of resolve.

We honor the lives lost, the heroes who rushed into danger, and the families who still carry grief.

May we meet tragedy’s memory with unity, love, and an unshakable commitment to one another.

My heart goes out to Charlie Kirk's family. This is a tragic shooting and from all appearances, it is an act of political violence. 

Political violence is on the rise and it is a sign of crisis and weakness in a democracy. I condemn all forms of political violence. We all must take responsibility for working to end it, to secure our democracy and to promote peace and strength in our nation and beyond.

The terrifying shooting today in Utah must be condemned. Political violence is never the answer. 

My heart is with Charlie Kirk’s family and the thousands who went to engage in peaceful political discourse and instead witnessed this horrific act of violence.

Every life is precious. On World Suicide Prevention Day, let us break the silence, extend compassion, and remind our loved ones they are never alone. Hope is real. Help is here. Together, we can save lives. If you need help right now, call or text 988.

After more than two years in captivity, I am deeply grateful that Elizabeth Tsurkov has been released and will finally be reunited with her family and loved ones. Thankful for all who partnered in advocating for her release and for all who tirelessly worked to ensure her safe return.
The Trump administration has made it clear — they don't care about working Americans. https://t.co/aMZgM8B7pV

In America, if you work hard, you should be able to afford a place to call home. To meet that ideal, on September 9, 1965, our nation established HUD – a bold commitment to that promise of fairness and dignity. Decades later, that mission still calls us. Skyrocketing housing prices have become a crisis for working families, and we must recommit to ensuring access to safe, affordable housing.

This decision is wrong. Allowing masked agents to racially profile people stands against the fundamental values our country was built on. As the three dissenting Justices made clear: this decision will create second class citizens, and undermines the rule of law which protects us all.
https://t.co/4NCOzdH0HA

This morning I heard from New Jersey teachers and parents about the high costs they're facing as the school year begins. As this budget fight gets underway I let them know I won't give away my vote for a Republican budget that makes their lives harder or more expensive. https://t.co/0YcszZTiqS
I'm not giving away my vote for a budget that hurts New Jerseyans or anybody in our nation. https://t.co/dkLph5EZVh

Trump's handpicked lackeys cannot hide the disastrous effects his policies are having on our economy. His tax cuts for the rich and chaotic tariff wars are costing jobs, raising prices on working families and killing opportunity for small businesses.

Employers added just 54,000 jobs last month, the weakest in nearly 10 months. This is an alarm. 

Trump promised a "new golden age". Instead, his failing economic policies leave working families behind. 

We must invest in the working class, not enrich billionaires.
If Trump and Republicans in Congress are going to propose a budget that will raise costs and cut health care, I am going to fight them every step of the way. https://t.co/SWu1nrGHb0
@SenatorWarnock Thank you brother!

This Labor Day, we honor the power of organized labor, the backbone of America’s middle class. 

But Donald Trump and Republicans have launched relentless attacks on unions, siding with billionaires and corporate greed over working people. 

We must stand with labor, protect the right to organize, and defend the dignity of work. Because when workers rise, America rises.

My heart is with the city of New Orleans and communities across the gulf today as they remember the destruction and loss that Hurricane Katrina brought to their shores 20 years ago. We all should be in awe of their resilience in a long and arduous recovery.

Trump ignored the rule of law, put his personal lawyer in charge of NJ, and now she’s making our state less safe.

Here is why Trump's temper tantrum about the Fed is bad for your wallet: 

1) He's putting your retirement savings at risk. 
2) It can raise costs on everything from groceries to car loans.
3) We need a leader who is serious about lowering costs for working families, not one who only wants to distract from the reality that their  agenda is deeply flawed, unpopular, and driving our economy into the ground.

The National Flood Insurance Program is in need of reform, and I’m proud to lead efforts to lower prices and increase access for New Jersey and communities across this country that rely on the NFIP. Please let us know what you think should be improved:

Back to school shopping is getting harder for working families. Trump’s tariffs mean kids’ shoes and clothes alone cost nearly 40% more. Under Trump expenses are higher for parents and kids, while the ultra-rich get even more handouts and special treatment. https://t.co/oLQZxjhrX9

Trump's attempted manipulation of the law to install his personal attorney, Alina Habba, as U.S. Attorney was clearly unlawful as the court recognized today. This legal limbo continues to thwart our prosecutors’ ability to tackle crime in every federal case across the state, putting public safety at risk.

The administration should immediately restore Desiree Grace to her role as interim U.S. Attorney while it works to identify and nominate a permanent, qualified individual.
My joint statement with @SenatorAndyKim on reports of ICE raids in Edison. https://t.co/8mDDAwc3Ac

Our democracy has endured nearly 250 years because people chose patriotism over politics.

We must make that choice again and stand up for our democracy.
Trump promised to bring prices down on day one. 200 days later, EVERYTHING is more expensive. Food, healthcare, energy...it's all going up. https://t.co/ZFzqcy1SdT

This new report shows how Trump's Department of Justice has turned into a corrupt pay-for-play system that harms our economy and leaves Americans paying the price.

Donald Trump promised to secure a ceasefire between Hamas and Israel in his first week in office, and now Secretary Rubio is compounding this administration’s failure of leadership with a policy that leaves Gazans who qualify for temporary medical and humanitarian visas—including seriously injured children and civilians who have been caught in the crossfire through no fault of their own— without this lifesaving recourse. Throughout this conflict, my office has relied on crucial humanitarian tools like this one to save innocent lives, and I have worked closely with the State Department under both the Trump and Biden Administrations to evacuate individuals in critical need of medical care and improve access to humanitarian aid and medical personnel and services in Gaza. Secretary Rubio must immediately reinstate the use of these temporary medical and humanitarian visas so we can save lives now and double down on the work needed to achieve a just and lasting peace in the region.
Trump is the type of deal-maker who ends up in bankruptcy (or six). The last thing Americans and Ukrainians need is another one of his bankrupt deals with Putin. https://t.co/gMTcviSItr

Donald Trump promised to lower costs for working families. He didn’t just break that promise, he betrayed it. While families struggle to afford groceries, he handed tax breaks to billionaires and big corporations.

Donald Trump sold out the American people.
We must stand up for our constitution and for each other.

For Trump, DC is just the beginning. This is a dangerous distraction. He will continue to push past the safeguards of our democracy because he has no other option. His economic policies are failing, public opinion is shifting away from him, and no matter how hard he tries, he will still be all over the Epstein files.

So today we must reject the lies, chaos, and cuts, and instead call back to Social Security’s founding and stand for this bedrock principle that if you work hard and pay your fair share, you should not go into poverty. https://t.co/5jzM9yPl8o

Instead of celebrating this vital and monumental program, Trump, Vance, and Musk have done everything they can to sabotage it, denying Americans what they have earned over the last 90 years. https://t.co/Pdwr1RiRqU
Over 1.7 million people rely on Social Security in New Jersey alone. My constituents are frustrated with Trump’s attacks on this program and fearful of what could be cut next. https://t.co/f3i85ZXYrv

On its 90th birthday, Social Security deserves to be celebrated. It is the most successful anti-poverty program ever, but Donald Trump and JD Vance are marking the anniversary by trying to pull the plug on a system every American pays into.
Trump doesn't care about the rule of law, and he doesn't care about D.C. This insulting stunt and abuse of power is all a distraction from his corruption and incompetence. https://t.co/1nQPZ1CXGo

Federalizing the MPD and sending the National Guard into the streets of D.C. will not make the District’s 700,000 residents safer. The best way to improve public safety is to fund and support programs that build trust, accountability, and transparency between communities and law enforcement, not by taking inflammatory actions that erode the public’s trust and create fear and chaos.

If Donald Trump wanted to make D.C. safer, he wouldn’t have pardoned the Jan. 6 criminals who violently assaulted law enforcement officers who were defending our nation’s Capitol. He wouldn’t have siphoned $1 billion from the District’s budget, undercutting programs that support police and improve public safety.

This power grab by Trump isn’t about D.C. crime rates—which have been falling—or improving public safety. Using U.S. military forces to enforce a policy agenda on American soil is a gross abuse of power that reeks of authoritarianism. Donald Trump continues to trample on Americans’ rights, the separation of powers, and the rule of law. This is a moment where every American who cares about our country and its ideals cannot stand by–it is a moment where we all must stand up for our democracy.

The Trump Justice Department just allowed another merger. United Health’s acquisition of Amedisys clears the way for the nation’s largest health insurance company to take over end of life care, potentially raising prices for your family. Quality affordable health care should be our top priority for American families.
As we mark the anniversary of the Voting Rights Act, we must take a stand to ensure access to the ballot box for all. https://t.co/fHVLG09edH
Glad to see service fully restored for PATH after this morning's fire. Grateful for emergency services who extinguished the fire and treated those injured.

Producers of the most commonly used pesticides are trying to avoid liability if their products cause harm. We must fight back against this legislation.

For 60 years Medicare and Medicaid have been a lifeline for tens of millions of Americans. Republican cuts to them will have devastating effects, but I know that together we can support these vital institutions.

With corporate corruption outweighing federal antitrust enforcement, Donald Trump is putting his business interests over a free and fair American economy that benefits all of us, not just the wealthiest few.

My Senate colleagues and I are demanding answers as to whether the HPE merger was for the public good, or to line the pockets of Trump's business allies.
https://t.co/d9r2yFdb3o

Witnessing the catastrophic hunger and suffering of civilians, especially children, women, the sick and elderly, in Gaza has been heartbreaking. The crisis in Gaza must be met with an immediate and drastic surge in life-saving resources, such as desperately needed food, water, and medicine–including therapeutic foods for those suffering from severe malnutrition. It is our collective moral duty to ensure that humanitarian relief reaches those who need it most urgently.
 
The strategy of the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation has not worked. Proven methods to get humanitarian aid to those in need while preventing diversion to Hamas must be used to flood the zone now. Every moment of delay will cost lives and cause irreparable harm to the health of children, pregnant women, and other civilians.
 
We must do all we can to address the humanitarian crisis in Gaza as part of the strategy to save lives, decrease Hamas’s influence and capabilities, release all remaining hostages, strengthen Israel’s security, and ultimately end this war. These goals are not mutually exclusive, rather they go hand-in-hand.

“Fraud, waste and abuse.”

“Crap.”

“Things that don’t matter.”

This is what the Trump administration calls the life-saving aid the Republican Congress just cut. 

But let’s call it what it is: cruelty. 

op: @HuffPost https://t.co/mCYWp0nNrA

Freedom of the press is at risk in our country with this President. These actions are a blatant signal to media companies that they need to cover the news to appease one man, rather than tell the American people the truth.

The once independent FCC has bent to President Trump’s business & political interests, approving the Paramount/Skydance merger after the former paid Trump $16 million, capitulating in the face of Trump’s baseless outrage over CBS’s coverage of the presidential election.

Trump’s executive order on college sports attempts to roll back athletes’ economic rights and close off pathways for future progress.

But executive orders aren't laws. Congress writes the laws. 

For years, I’ve worked across the aisle to advance proposals to strengthen college sports—and I’ll continue fighting for legislation that empowers athletes, promotes stability, and ensures that others can benefit from the same life-changing opportunities I had as a college athlete.

In a few minutes, I’ll be on the Senate floor to speak out against  Emil Bove -  Trump’s appellate court nominee who’s been rebuked by over 75 former federal and state judges and more than 900 ex‑DOJ lawyers for his troubling record and partisan loyalty.

This isn’t someone we should trust with a lifetime seat.

Today is #BUMPDAY! I am thrilled to be a supporter on legislation designed to uplift moms and increase maternal health standards in America. From the MOMMIES Act to the entire Momnibus, we must act to protect moms during delivery and pre- and post-natal.

Trump’s Department of Justice is once again criticizing a court that acted within its authority, continuing a pattern of publicly undermining judicial decisions and showing disregard for the rule of law and the separation of powers.

The firing of a career public servant, lawfully appointed by the court, is another blatant attempt to intimidate anyone that doesn’t agree with them and undermine judicial independence. 

This Administration may not like the law, but they are not above it. 

The people of New Jersey deserve a U.S. Attorney who will enforce the law and pursue justice for the people of our state without partisanship or politics.

I respect the District Court’s decision today to exercise its authority to appoint a new United States Attorney for the District of New Jersey and congratulate Desiree Grace, who has served as a prosecutor in the office since 2016, on her appointment. 
 
The people of New Jersey deserve a United States Attorney who will enforce the law without fear or favor, always in pursuit of the public interest and guided by the principles of impartiality and fairness.

There is an intentional erosion of our separation of powers.

Heartbroken by the devastation caused by yesterday’s storms in New Jersey. My prayers are with the families of the two women whose lives were tragically lost in the flooding in Plainfield last night.

Our railways are like vital arteries, carrying people, goods, and opportunity across America, but after years of neglect, they’ve become clogged by outdated and crumbling infrastructure. That’s why I’m proud to stand with our New Jersey Workers building our bridges. By securing significant federal funding for this $2.2 billion project, including $495 million from Amtrak and roughly 50 percent of the remaining $1.73 billion from key federal transit programs. This investment will strengthen our economy, improve safety, and support the workers who are not just building our bridges, but building the American middle class. When we invest in infrastructure, we invest in our future.

At long last we are making progress on one of our nation’s largest infrastructure projects. The new Portal North Bridge will allow NJ TRANSIT and Amtrak to reliably serve New Jerseyans for years to come. https://t.co/n60L5GYtA8

Grateful for New Jersey leaders who will continue to fight for the Constitution’s guarantee of birthright citizenship.

Today’s procedural decision by the Supreme Court is an abdication of the judiciary’s role to protect all Americans when the President violates the Constitution. Importantly, birthright citizenship, which has been a core tenet of our Constitution for more than 150 years, remains. But Justice Sotomayor explains the dangerous consequences of this decision.

In the decade since the Obergefell decision affirmed the right to marriage equality nationwide, it has been awe-inspiring to see celebrations of love flourish across our country. But we celebrate this anniversary with the recognition that LGTBQ Americans’ rights are under attack and the fight continues. I will continue to stand up for equality for the LGBTQ community.

In addition to throwing 16 million people off their healthcare, cutting food assistance for 2 million hungry kids, and slashing taxes for billionaires, the Republican budget bill would punish states that adopt AI regulations at any point over the next decade.
 
This would undermine states’ ability to address real and pressing harms, like AI systems that enable discrimination in hiring, housing, and healthcare.
 
America should lead the world in AI and other emerging technologies—and in setting clear rules of the road to ensure they align with the public interest.
 
These goals aren’t in conflict. They reinforce one another. This provision undermines both.
 
I oppose it.
Emil Bove has no respect for the rule of law and court orders. He does not belong on the federal bench. https://t.co/sVmwXjxkeO

The conditions at the Delaney Hall ICE detention facility in Newark are untenable. With serious security lapses, numerous reports of mistreatment by staff of detainees, complaints of persistent food shortages, and a troubling lack of transparency from facility administrators, it’s clear that GEO Group has shown it cannot—or will not—operate Delaney Hall humanely or safely. I have long opposed privately owned and operated immigration detention facilities because they are mired by rampant abuse and neglect of those in their care. 

After spending millions of dollars in upgrades it continues to be a house of horrors. The consequences of GEO’s mismanagement, and the Department of Homeland Security’s resistance to Congressional oversight, are borne by my neighbors in Newark and those detained at Delaney Hall. The Department of Homeland Security has a duty to work with Congress to address the problem, take immediate action to improve the conditions at Delaney Hall, and ensure the proper and fair treatment of those detained.

We all know what we saw.

Now, Trump is deploying hundreds of active-duty Marines as a misguided show of force against American citizens and residents, which would only escalate the situation and further endanger the public, law enforcement, and our servicemembers.
 
By unilaterally sending the military into states over their objections, Donald Trump is setting a dangerous precedent for further violations of separation of powers and the rule of law in America. We cannot stand by while the president tests the limits of our democracy. I stand with California, the state and local law enforcement officers who are working to maintain the peace, and our servicemembers. Trump’s reckless and discriminatory travel ban doesn’t make us safer. All it will do is further isolate the United Statesfrom our allies and weaken our global leadership. Indiscriminately closing our doors to people fleeing violence and instability, preventing U.S. citizens from reuniting with their families, or singling out people simply because of the country in which they were born, is antithetical to our nation’s most fundamental values.
 
This ban also comes at a time when Trump hasredirected significant counterterrorism resources to deporting longtime, taxpaying, law-abiding, U.S. residents. Our national security officers should be focused on investigating serious threats, not barring entry to our country based on bias and pretext.
 
Like we did in his first term, Americans must once again stand up against this renewed attempt to vilify and exclude at the expense of our most cherished values.
